comments:
I am getting following error in installed system. It is working fine in development system. Problem appeared after I added the method. Method is obfuscated in the build but I don't think that obfuscation is causing it.

Can you help me identify the cause. I have googled a lot but did not find any clue. Nothing is working because of this problem.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 2006-07-12 17:23:54.00
!MESSAGE Internal plug-in action delegate error on creation.
!STACK 0

Do you use different VMs on the development and production systems? The trace like this might be caused, for instance, by using 1.5 JVM to to build a plugin in the development environment and running it in the production system with 1.4 JVM.

We build our plugins with JDK 1.3.1_09. This is for supporting integration with WSAD 5.1.1 (which uses IBM JDK 1.3). In our standalone product we use JDK 1.4.2_04. We bundle eclipse plugins from Eclipse 3.1.2. I don't know about the JDK  used to build them. This setup has been working fine for last one year. We were using Eclipse 3.0 plugins before 3.1.2 was released.
Problem started occurring after I added methods that use PDE Core plugin. Same problem is occurring when I integrate my plugins in Eclipse. I have even tried using JDK 1.5.0_06.
On further investigating the build process, I found that we were still using the Eclipse 3.0 JDT compiler. Changing that to Eclipse 3.2 JDT compiler solved the problem.

traces.message: (class: com/appperfect/devtest/ui/a/c/b, method: a signature: (Lorg/eclipse/core/resources/IProject;Lorg/eclipse/core/resources/IProject;)Lorg/eclipse/pde/internal/core/plugin/WorkspacePluginModel;) Incompatible object argument for function call
